Key Match Events: Andrés Giménez singled home José Ramírez from second base in the 10th inning
Eli Morgan got out of a jam by retiring Carlos Correa on a foul pop and Byron Buxton on a liner to right
Pre-Game Insights: The goal is to get in
You get in, you have a chance
Post-Match Reflections: The goal is to get in
You get in, you have a chance
Cleveland now has a chance to possibly end baseball's longest active World Series drought, dating to 1948
He’s one of the most special humans I’ve ever met, not just as a manager but as a man
We had one of the greatest managers in the history of baseball for a long time and I love Terry Francona with all my heart. But this was probably the best year of managing I’ve seen in all my life.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland's second baseman then hit a 3-2 pitch into right to easily score Ramírez
Cleveland's bullpen, which has carried the team all season, combined for 5 2/3 hitless innings
Rookie Kyle Manzardo homered for the Guardians, who lowered the magic number to clinch the AL Central title to three
Others: Cleveland's dugout emptied onto the field in celebration
The Twins threatened in the 10th, loading the bases with one out against Eli Morgan
The Guardians overcame losing ace Shane Bieber in the first weeks of the season
Vogt spent most of the season plugging holes in his rotation due to injuries and ineffectiveness
